definitions: To arrange to receive something regularly, typically a publication, by paying in advance.
To express agreement with or support for an idea, belief, or cause.
To contribute money to a fund or for a purpose.
To sign one's name to a document or agreement.
examples: She subscribed to several fashion magazines.
He subscribed to the theory of evolution.
The members subscribed generously to the charity.
The witness subscribed his name to the affidavit.
